results.text: Whether you’re the brains or the brawn, you know how to get someone to give up the goods. The target creature immediately hands over an item or provides you with pertinent information before running away.
Whether your threats are overt or subtle, you’re an expert at getting the point across. You have advantage on your next Intimidation check.

You touch on a sensitive subject for the target, such as a close friend, loved one, or a potential source of blackmail. They provide you with information in exchange for the safety of their loved ones or your silence on delicate matters.
Your presence is truly terrifying. Creatures of your choice with a CR equal to half your character level (rounded down) are frightened of you for [[/r 1d4]] rounds.
You know the right amount of pressure to put on to get the answers you want. You learn a piece of Key Information from one creature you are currently questioning.

You flourish your weapon, beat your chest, or glare threateningly at your foes, instilling fear in them. Enemy creatures who can see you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (DC 15) or be cowed (Trials & Treasures, pg. 361) by you until the start of their next turn.
